1_INTRODUCTION: Introduce learning-based correspondence hallucination for non-covisible image regions
Propose NeurHal: network to identify and hallucinate correspondences
Input: image pair and source keypoints; output per-keypoint target-location probability distribution
Design task-specific loss and architecture via problem analysis
Boost absolute pose estimation robustness over SOTA feature matching
3_OUR_APPROACH: Train network to localize correspondents despite occlusion and field-of-view gaps
Predict per-keypoint probability map over the target image plane
Use NRE to unify identify, inpaint, and outpaint correspondents
Propose memory-efficient architecture NeurHal with low-resolution correspondence maps
Employ CNN with effective stride eight for correspondence map computation
Low-resolution maps enable correspondence hallucination for absolute pose estimation
4_EXPERIMENTS: Evaluate NeurHal's hallucination ability and impact on absolute pose robustness
Baselines fail at inpainting and cannot outpaint correspondences
NeurHal hallucinates correspondences with strong cross-dataset generalization
Low-overlap: NeurHal estimates camera pose correctly far more often
High-overlap: SOTA slightly better due to higher-resolution correspondence maps
Overall, hallucinated outpainting improves absolute pose estimation
5_LIMITATIONS: Inpainted correspondence maps are less peaked than outpainted maps
Architecture outputs low-resolution correspondences due to quadratic attention complexity
Finite map extent misses correspondents outside, producing erroneous maps
6_CONCLUSION: Introduces first method to learn inpaint and outpaint correspondences
Analyzes the task to choose loss and design architecture
Demonstrates strong generalization across unseen indoor/outdoor scenes and datasets
Validates on ScanNet, MegaDepth, ETH3D, and NYU
Boosts absolute pose estimation; outpainted correspondences outperform SOTA feature matching
Enables robust SfM when few images are available
7_ETHICS_STATEMENT: Improves vision-based industrial applications, especially GPS-denied visual localization.
Boosts robotics and AR relocalization, promoting safer system behavior.
Enables autonomous driving and drone search-and-rescue benefits.
Carries misuse risk: stronger weaponized UAVs, environment re-identification privacy threats.
Urges ethical debates and regulatory oversight by governments and public entities.
Anticipates net societal benefits outweigh potential harms.
8_REPRODUCIBILITY: Release NeurHal architecture and pretrained weights
Provide simple evaluation script for qualitative results
Share notebook with indoor smartphone image example

Outputs a peaked probability map over target keypoint location
Hallucinates correspondences in scenes unseen during training
Significantly improves robustness for absolute pose estimation versus SOTA matchers
